intro: Pinalia bogoriensis, commonly known as the Borneo pine, is a rare tropical plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It is a member of the Podocarpaceae family, which includes various coniferous species. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and distinctive cone-like structures. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
